page.title: 14Flookburgh Charter Fair
page.content: In the year of 1664,King Charles the Second,granted a{Royal Charter}to the people of{Flookburgh,}allowing them to have a fair in the streets.This act formalised an existing charter given in the 13th century. Now the fair is held on the nearest Saturday to Midsummers Day.Decorated floats,entered by local groups,parade through the streets. In 1985 I was selected to be{Charter {Queen.}My family decorated a float for me and my court to travel to the field on the outskirts of the village,where everyone gathered. On the field we celebrated the day with competitions and games.There were stalls all around the arena, the money raised on the day was given to local charities. The Charter is displayed in{St.John {the Baptist's Church,Flookburgh.
